intro: Cyphostemma marojejyense, commonly known as the Madagascar moonvine, is a climbing shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its tendrils and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that give way to orange fruits, which are edible but have a bitter taste. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
